connector.description: Send and receive SMS messages using a SMSC (Short Message Service Center).

camel.sink.path.host.name: camel.sink.path.host
camel.sink.path.host.description: Hostname for the SMSC server to use.

camel.sink.path.port.name: camel.sink.path.port
camel.sink.path.port.description: Port number for the SMSC server to use.

camel.sink.endpoint.initialReconnectDela.name: camel.sink.endpoint.initialReconnectDelay
camel.sink.endpoint.initialReconnectDela.description: Defines the initial delay in milliseconds after the consumer/producer tries to reconnect to the SMSC, after the connection was lost.

camel.sink.endpoint.maxReconnect.name: camel.sink.endpoint.maxReconnect
camel.sink.endpoint.maxReconnect.description: Defines the maximum number of attempts to reconnect to the SMSC, if SMSC returns a negative bind response

camel.sink.endpoint.reconnectDelay.name: camel.sink.endpoint.reconnectDelay
camel.sink.endpoint.reconnectDelay.description: Defines the interval in milliseconds between the reconnect attempts, if the connection to the SMSC was lost and the previous was not succeed.

camel.sink.endpoint.splittingPolicy.name: camel.sink.endpoint.splittingPolicy
camel.sink.endpoint.splittingPolicy.description: You can specify a policy for handling long messages: ALLOW - the default, long messages are split to 140 bytes per message TRUNCATE - long messages are split and only the first fragment will be sent to the SMSC. Some carriers drop subsequent fragments so this reduces load on the SMPP connection sending parts of a message that will never be delivered. REJECT - if a message would need to be split, it is rejected with an SMPP NegativeResponseException and the reason code signifying the message is too long. One of: [ALLOW] [REJECT] [TRUNCATE]

camel.sink.endpoint.systemType.name: camel.sink.endpoint.systemType
camel.sink.endpoint.systemType.description: This parameter is used to categorize the type of ESME (External Short Message Entity) that is binding to the SMSC (max. 13 characters).

camel.sink.endpoint.destAddr.name: camel.sink.endpoint.destAddr
camel.sink.endpoint.destAddr.description: Defines the destination SME address. For mobile terminated messages, this is the directory number of the recipient MS. Only for SubmitSm, SubmitMulti, CancelSm and DataSm.

camel.sink.endpoint.destAddrNpi.name: camel.sink.endpoint.destAddrNpi
camel.sink.endpoint.destAddrNpi.description: Defines the type of number (TON) to be used in the SME destination address parameters. Only for SubmitSm, SubmitMulti, CancelSm and DataSm. The following NPI values are defined: 0: Unknown 1: ISDN (E163/E164) 2: Data (X.121) 3: Telex (F.69) 6: Land Mobile (E.212) 8: National 9: Private 10: ERMES 13: Internet (IP) 18: WAP Client Id (to be defined by WAP Forum) One of: [0] [1] [2] [3] [6] [8] [9] [10] [13] [18]

camel.sink.endpoint.destAddrTon.name: camel.sink.endpoint.destAddrTon
camel.sink.endpoint.destAddrTon.description: Defines the type of number (TON) to be used in the SME destination address parameters. Only for SubmitSm, SubmitMulti, CancelSm and DataSm. The following TON values are defined: 0: Unknown 1: International 2: National 3: Network Specific 4: Subscriber Number 5: Alphanumeric 6: Abbreviated One of: [0] [1] [2] [3] [4] [5] [6]

camel.sink.endpoint.lazySessionCreation.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazySessionCreation
camel.sink.endpoint.lazySessionCreation.description: Sessions can be lazily created to avoid exceptions, if the SMSC is not available when the Camel producer is started. Camel will check the in message headers 'CamelSmppSystemId' and 'CamelSmppPassword' of the first exchange. If they are present, Camel will use these data to connect to the SMSC.

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.numberingPlanIndicat.name: camel.sink.endpoint.numberingPlanIndicator
camel.sink.endpoint.numberingPlanIndicat.description: Defines the numeric plan indicator (NPI) to be used in the SME. The following NPI values are defined: 0: Unknown 1: ISDN (E163/E164) 2: Data (X.121) 3: Telex (F.69) 6: Land Mobile (E.212) 8: National 9: Private 10: ERMES 13: Internet (IP) 18: WAP Client Id (to be defined by WAP Forum) One of: [0] [1] [2] [3] [6] [8] [9] [10] [13] [18]

camel.sink.endpoint.priorityFlag.name: camel.sink.endpoint.priorityFlag
camel.sink.endpoint.priorityFlag.description: Allows the originating SME to assign a priority level to the short message. Only for SubmitSm and SubmitMulti. Four Priority Levels are supported: 0: Level 0 (lowest) priority 1: Level 1 priority 2: Level 2 priority 3: Level 3 (highest) priority One of: [0] [1] [2] [3]

camel.sink.endpoint.registeredDelivery.name: camel.sink.endpoint.registeredDelivery
camel.sink.endpoint.registeredDelivery.description: Is used to request an SMSC delivery receipt and/or SME originated acknowledgements. The following values are defined: 0: No SMSC delivery receipt requested. 1: SMSC delivery receipt requested where final delivery outcome is success or failure. 2: SMSC delivery receipt requested where the final delivery outcome is delivery failure. One of: [0] [1] [2]

camel.sink.endpoint.replaceIfPresentFlag.name: camel.sink.endpoint.replaceIfPresentFlag
camel.sink.endpoint.replaceIfPresentFlag.description: Used to request the SMSC to replace a previously submitted message, that is still pending delivery. The SMSC will replace an existing message provided that the source address, destination address and service type match the same fields in the new message. The following replace if present flag values are defined: 0: Don't replace 1: Replace One of: [0] [1]

camel.sink.endpoint.serviceType.name: camel.sink.endpoint.serviceType
camel.sink.endpoint.serviceType.description: The service type parameter can be used to indicate the SMS Application service associated with the message. The following generic service_types are defined: CMT: Cellular Messaging CPT: Cellular Paging VMN: Voice Mail Notification VMA: Voice Mail Alerting WAP: Wireless Application Protocol USSD: Unstructured Supplementary Services Data One of: [CMT] [CPT] [VMN] [VMA] [WAP] [USSD]

camel.sink.endpoint.sourceAddr.name: camel.sink.endpoint.sourceAddr
camel.sink.endpoint.sourceAddr.description: Defines the address of SME (Short Message Entity) which originated this message.

camel.sink.endpoint.sourceAddrNpi.name: camel.sink.endpoint.sourceAddrNpi
camel.sink.endpoint.sourceAddrNpi.description: Defines the numeric plan indicator (NPI) to be used in the SME originator address parameters. The following NPI values are defined: 0: Unknown 1: ISDN (E163/E164) 2: Data (X.121) 3: Telex (F.69) 6: Land Mobile (E.212) 8: National 9: Private 10: ERMES 13: Internet (IP) 18: WAP Client Id (to be defined by WAP Forum) One of: [0] [1] [2] [3] [6] [8] [9] [10] [13] [18]

camel.sink.endpoint.sourceAddrTon.name: camel.sink.endpoint.sourceAddrTon
camel.sink.endpoint.sourceAddrTon.description: Defines the type of number (TON) to be used in the SME originator address parameters. The following TON values are defined: 0: Unknown 1: International 2: National 3: Network Specific 4: Subscriber Number 5: Alphanumeric 6: Abbreviated One of: [0] [1] [2] [3] [4] [5] [6]

camel.sink.endpoint.typeOfNumber.name: camel.sink.endpoint.typeOfNumber
camel.sink.endpoint.typeOfNumber.description: Defines the type of number (TON) to be used in the SME. The following TON values are defined: 0: Unknown 1: International 2: National 3: Network Specific 4: Subscriber Number 5: Alphanumeric 6: Abbreviated One of: [0] [1] [2] [3] [4] [5] [6]

camel.sink.endpoint.enquireLinkTimer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.enquireLinkTimer
camel.sink.endpoint.enquireLinkTimer.description: Defines the interval in milliseconds between the confidence checks. The confidence check is used to test the communication path between an ESME and an SMSC.

camel.sink.endpoint.sessionStateListener.name: camel.sink.endpoint.sessionStateListener
camel.sink.endpoint.sessionStateListener.description: You can refer to a org.jsmpp.session.SessionStateListener in the Registry to receive callbacks when the session state changed.

camel.sink.endpoint.transactionTimer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.transactionTimer
camel.sink.endpoint.transactionTimer.description: Defines the maximum period of inactivity allowed after a transaction, after which an SMPP entity may assume that the session is no longer active. This timer may be active on either communicating SMPP entity (i.e. SMSC or ESME).

camel.sink.endpoint.alphabet.name: camel.sink.endpoint.alphabet
camel.sink.endpoint.alphabet.description: Defines encoding of data according the SMPP 3.4 specification, section 5.2.19. 0: SMSC Default Alphabet 4: 8 bit Alphabet 8: UCS2 Alphabet One of: [0] [4] [8]

camel.sink.endpoint.dataCoding.name: camel.sink.endpoint.dataCoding
camel.sink.endpoint.dataCoding.description: Defines the data coding according the SMPP 3.4 specification, section 5.2.19. Example data encodings are: 0: SMSC Default Alphabet 3: Latin 1 (ISO-8859-1) 4: Octet unspecified (8-bit binary) 8: UCS2 (ISO/IEC-10646) 13: Extended Kanji JIS(X 0212-1990)

camel.sink.endpoint.encoding.name: camel.sink.endpoint.encoding
camel.sink.endpoint.encoding.description: Defines the encoding scheme of the short message user data. Only for SubmitSm, ReplaceSm and SubmitMulti.

camel.sink.endpoint.httpProxyHost.name: camel.sink.endpoint.httpProxyHost
camel.sink.endpoint.httpProxyHost.description: If you need to tunnel SMPP through a HTTP proxy, set this attribute to the hostname or ip address of your HTTP proxy.

camel.sink.endpoint.httpProxyPassword.name: camel.sink.endpoint.httpProxyPassword
camel.sink.endpoint.httpProxyPassword.description: If your HTTP proxy requires basic authentication, set this attribute to the password required for your HTTP proxy.

camel.sink.endpoint.httpProxyPort.name: camel.sink.endpoint.httpProxyPort
camel.sink.endpoint.httpProxyPort.description: If you need to tunnel SMPP through a HTTP proxy, set this attribute to the port of your HTTP proxy.

camel.sink.endpoint.httpProxyUsername.name: camel.sink.endpoint.httpProxyUsername
camel.sink.endpoint.httpProxyUsername.description: If your HTTP proxy requires basic authentication, set this attribute to the username required for your HTTP proxy.

camel.sink.endpoint.proxyHeaders.name: camel.sink.endpoint.proxyHeaders
camel.sink.endpoint.proxyHeaders.description: These headers will be passed to the proxy server while establishing the connection.

camel.sink.endpoint.password.name: camel.sink.endpoint.password
camel.sink.endpoint.password.description: The password for connecting to SMSC server.

camel.sink.endpoint.systemId.name: camel.sink.endpoint.systemId
camel.sink.endpoint.systemId.description: The system id (username) for connecting to SMSC server.

camel.sink.endpoint.usingSSL.name: camel.sink.endpoint.usingSSL
camel.sink.endpoint.usingSSL.description: Whether using SSL with the smpps protocol

camel.component.smpp.initialReconnectDel.name: camel.component.smpp.initialReconnectDelay
camel.component.smpp.initialReconnectDel.description: Defines the initial delay in milliseconds after the consumer/producer tries to reconnect to the SMSC, after the connection was lost.

camel.component.smpp.maxReconnect.name: camel.component.smpp.maxReconnect
camel.component.smpp.maxReconnect.description: Defines the maximum number of attempts to reconnect to the SMSC, if SMSC returns a negative bind response

camel.component.smpp.reconnectDelay.name: camel.component.smpp.reconnectDelay
camel.component.smpp.reconnectDelay.description: Defines the interval in milliseconds between the reconnect attempts, if the connection to the SMSC was lost and the previous was not succeed.

camel.component.smpp.splittingPolicy.name: camel.component.smpp.splittingPolicy
camel.component.smpp.splittingPolicy.description: You can specify a policy for handling long messages: ALLOW - the default, long messages are split to 140 bytes per message TRUNCATE - long messages are split and only the first fragment will be sent to the SMSC. Some carriers drop subsequent fragments so this reduces load on the SMPP connection sending parts of a message that will never be delivered. REJECT - if a message would need to be split, it is rejected with an SMPP NegativeResponseException and the reason code signifying the message is too long. One of: [ALLOW] [REJECT] [TRUNCATE]

camel.component.smpp.systemType.name: camel.component.smpp.systemType
camel.component.smpp.systemType.description: This parameter is used to categorize the type of ESME (External Short Message Entity) that is binding to the SMSC (max. 13 characters).

camel.component.smpp.destAddr.name: camel.component.smpp.destAddr
camel.component.smpp.destAddr.description: Defines the destination SME address. For mobile terminated messages, this is the directory number of the recipient MS. Only for SubmitSm, SubmitMulti, CancelSm and DataSm.

camel.component.smpp.destAddrNpi.name: camel.component.smpp.destAddrNpi
camel.component.smpp.destAddrNpi.description: Defines the type of number (TON) to be used in the SME destination address parameters. Only for SubmitSm, SubmitMulti, CancelSm and DataSm. The following NPI values are defined: 0: Unknown 1: ISDN (E163/E164) 2: Data (X.121) 3: Telex (F.69) 6: Land Mobile (E.212) 8: National 9: Private 10: ERMES 13: Internet (IP) 18: WAP Client Id (to be defined by WAP Forum) One of: [0] [1] [2] [3] [6] [8] [9] [10] [13] [18]

camel.component.smpp.destAddrTon.name: camel.component.smpp.destAddrTon
camel.component.smpp.destAddrTon.description: Defines the type of number (TON) to be used in the SME destination address parameters. Only for SubmitSm, SubmitMulti, CancelSm and DataSm. The following TON values are defined: 0: Unknown 1: International 2: National 3: Network Specific 4: Subscriber Number 5: Alphanumeric 6: Abbreviated One of: [0] [1] [2] [3] [4] [5] [6]

camel.component.smpp.lazySessionCreation.name: camel.component.smpp.lazySessionCreation
camel.component.smpp.lazySessionCreation.description: Sessions can be lazily created to avoid exceptions, if the SMSC is not available when the Camel producer is started. Camel will check the in message headers 'CamelSmppSystemId' and 'CamelSmppPassword' of the first exchange. If they are present, Camel will use these data to connect to the SMSC.

camel.component.smpp.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.component.smpp.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.smpp.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.smpp.numberingPlanIndica.name: camel.component.smpp.numberingPlanIndicator
camel.component.smpp.numberingPlanIndica.description: Defines the numeric plan indicator (NPI) to be used in the SME. The following NPI values are defined: 0: Unknown 1: ISDN (E163/E164) 2: Data (X.121) 3: Telex (F.69) 6: Land Mobile (E.212) 8: National 9: Private 10: ERMES 13: Internet (IP) 18: WAP Client Id (to be defined by WAP Forum) One of: [0] [1] [2] [3] [6] [8] [9] [10] [13] [18]

camel.component.smpp.priorityFlag.name: camel.component.smpp.priorityFlag
camel.component.smpp.priorityFlag.description: Allows the originating SME to assign a priority level to the short message. Only for SubmitSm and SubmitMulti. Four Priority Levels are supported: 0: Level 0 (lowest) priority 1: Level 1 priority 2: Level 2 priority 3: Level 3 (highest) priority One of: [0] [1] [2] [3]

camel.component.smpp.registeredDelivery.name: camel.component.smpp.registeredDelivery
camel.component.smpp.registeredDelivery.description: Is used to request an SMSC delivery receipt and/or SME originated acknowledgements. The following values are defined: 0: No SMSC delivery receipt requested. 1: SMSC delivery receipt requested where final delivery outcome is success or failure. 2: SMSC delivery receipt requested where the final delivery outcome is delivery failure. One of: [0] [1] [2]

camel.component.smpp.replaceIfPresentFla.name: camel.component.smpp.replaceIfPresentFlag
camel.component.smpp.replaceIfPresentFla.description: Used to request the SMSC to replace a previously submitted message, that is still pending delivery. The SMSC will replace an existing message provided that the source address, destination address and service type match the same fields in the new message. The following replace if present flag values are defined: 0: Don't replace 1: Replace One of: [0] [1]

camel.component.smpp.serviceType.name: camel.component.smpp.serviceType
camel.component.smpp.serviceType.description: The service type parameter can be used to indicate the SMS Application service associated with the message. The following generic service_types are defined: CMT: Cellular Messaging CPT: Cellular Paging VMN: Voice Mail Notification VMA: Voice Mail Alerting WAP: Wireless Application Protocol USSD: Unstructured Supplementary Services Data One of: [CMT] [CPT] [VMN] [VMA] [WAP] [USSD]

camel.component.smpp.sourceAddr.name: camel.component.smpp.sourceAddr
camel.component.smpp.sourceAddr.description: Defines the address of SME (Short Message Entity) which originated this message.

camel.component.smpp.sourceAddrNpi.name: camel.component.smpp.sourceAddrNpi
camel.component.smpp.sourceAddrNpi.description: Defines the numeric plan indicator (NPI) to be used in the SME originator address parameters. The following NPI values are defined: 0: Unknown 1: ISDN (E163/E164) 2: Data (X.121) 3: Telex (F.69) 6: Land Mobile (E.212) 8: National 9: Private 10: ERMES 13: Internet (IP) 18: WAP Client Id (to be defined by WAP Forum) One of: [0] [1] [2] [3] [6] [8] [9] [10] [13] [18]

camel.component.smpp.sourceAddrTon.name: camel.component.smpp.sourceAddrTon
camel.component.smpp.sourceAddrTon.description: Defines the type of number (TON) to be used in the SME originator address parameters. The following TON values are defined: 0: Unknown 1: International 2: National 3: Network Specific 4: Subscriber Number 5: Alphanumeric 6: Abbreviated One of: [0] [1] [2] [3] [4] [5] [6]

camel.component.smpp.typeOfNumber.name: camel.component.smpp.typeOfNumber
camel.component.smpp.typeOfNumber.description: Defines the type of number (TON) to be used in the SME. The following TON values are defined: 0: Unknown 1: International 2: National 3: Network Specific 4: Subscriber Number 5: Alphanumeric 6: Abbreviated One of: [0] [1] [2] [3] [4] [5] [6]

camel.component.smpp.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.smpp.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.smpp.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.smpp.configuration.name: camel.component.smpp.configuration
camel.component.smpp.configuration.description: To use the shared SmppConfiguration as configuration.

camel.component.smpp.enquireLinkTimer.name: camel.component.smpp.enquireLinkTimer
camel.component.smpp.enquireLinkTimer.description: Defines the interval in milliseconds between the confidence checks. The confidence check is used to test the communication path between an ESME and an SMSC.

camel.component.smpp.sessionStateListene.name: camel.component.smpp.sessionStateListener
camel.component.smpp.sessionStateListene.description: You can refer to a org.jsmpp.session.SessionStateListener in the Registry to receive callbacks when the session state changed.

camel.component.smpp.transactionTimer.name: camel.component.smpp.transactionTimer
camel.component.smpp.transactionTimer.description: Defines the maximum period of inactivity allowed after a transaction, after which an SMPP entity may assume that the session is no longer active. This timer may be active on either communicating SMPP entity (i.e. SMSC or ESME).

camel.component.smpp.alphabet.name: camel.component.smpp.alphabet
camel.component.smpp.alphabet.description: Defines encoding of data according the SMPP 3.4 specification, section 5.2.19. 0: SMSC Default Alphabet 4: 8 bit Alphabet 8: UCS2 Alphabet One of: [0] [4] [8]

camel.component.smpp.dataCoding.name: camel.component.smpp.dataCoding
camel.component.smpp.dataCoding.description: Defines the data coding according the SMPP 3.4 specification, section 5.2.19. Example data encodings are: 0: SMSC Default Alphabet 3: Latin 1 (ISO-8859-1) 4: Octet unspecified (8-bit binary) 8: UCS2 (ISO/IEC-10646) 13: Extended Kanji JIS(X 0212-1990)

camel.component.smpp.encoding.name: camel.component.smpp.encoding
camel.component.smpp.encoding.description: Defines the encoding scheme of the short message user data. Only for SubmitSm, ReplaceSm and SubmitMulti.

camel.component.smpp.httpProxyHost.name: camel.component.smpp.httpProxyHost
camel.component.smpp.httpProxyHost.description: If you need to tunnel SMPP through a HTTP proxy, set this attribute to the hostname or ip address of your HTTP proxy.

camel.component.smpp.httpProxyPassword.name: camel.component.smpp.httpProxyPassword
camel.component.smpp.httpProxyPassword.description: If your HTTP proxy requires basic authentication, set this attribute to the password required for your HTTP proxy.

camel.component.smpp.httpProxyPort.name: camel.component.smpp.httpProxyPort
camel.component.smpp.httpProxyPort.description: If you need to tunnel SMPP through a HTTP proxy, set this attribute to the port of your HTTP proxy.

camel.component.smpp.httpProxyUsername.name: camel.component.smpp.httpProxyUsername
camel.component.smpp.httpProxyUsername.description: If your HTTP proxy requires basic authentication, set this attribute to the username required for your HTTP proxy.

camel.component.smpp.proxyHeaders.name: camel.component.smpp.proxyHeaders
camel.component.smpp.proxyHeaders.description: These headers will be passed to the proxy server while establishing the connection.

camel.component.smpp.password.name: camel.component.smpp.password
camel.component.smpp.password.description: The password for connecting to SMSC server.

camel.component.smpp.systemId.name: camel.component.smpp.systemId
camel.component.smpp.systemId.description: The system id (username) for connecting to SMSC server.

camel.component.smpp.usingSSL.name: camel.component.smpp.usingSSL
camel.component.smpp.usingSSL.description: Whether using SSL with the smpps protocol
